description:
It's been a thousand years since the Gauna, a strange alien race with no known method of communication, destroyed the solar system. A portion of humanity managed to escape using enormous "seed ships" like the Sidonia, which have allowed them to maintain the population while drifting through space. Nagate Tanikaze is a young man who has been raised deep in the bowels of the ship. When he goes into training to pilot the huge robotic weapons known as Gardes, Nagate is entrusted with piloting the legendary unit known as Tsugumori. Nagate and his fellow pilots put their lives on the line against the Gauna, in the ultimate battle for the survival of humanity!

(Source: AniDB)

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Agender
tags.description: Prominently features agender characters.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

title.native: シドニアの騎士　第九惑星戦役
劇場版 シドニアの騎士

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tsutomu_nihei)

Nihei studied architecture and after that, he went abroad to work for one year in New York. After that year, he returned to Japan and decided to become a mangaka. He started at Kodansha's Afternoon, and has been Takahashi Tsutomu's assistant for a while (working on Jiraishin).
Hiroyuki Seshita is an animation director, CG director and director.

A native of Tokyo, Noriyuki Asakura made his debut into the music industry in 1982, performing the theme song for a TV series. Since then his career has expanded in the direction of composing and producing, including writing songs for pop artists such as Hikaru Nishida and Kahoru Kohiruimaki. But as his creative interests began to diversify, he started focusing more on soundtrack composition for TV, anime, games and motion pictures. His dual experience in both pop and soundtrack production makes him one of the very few individuals capable of producing high quality material in either field. Noriyuki's musical savvy is featured in the soundtrack for the popular animation series "Rurouni Kenshin" (1995), and the international success of PlayStation game "Tenchu"(1998) gave people all around the world a chance to experience his unique Pan-Asian sound. Currently he has just finished working on the soundtrack for "Tenchu 2", and is looking for opportunities in Hollywood in which his musical style - which fuses elements from throughout Asia, spanning from the Middle East and Western Asia to traditional Chinese and Japanese - can be used as a vehicle to move and excite the listener in a way that only he can do.    Source: www-n.asakura.com

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).
